Reviews.Title: “Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: sue_dunks
Reviews.Content: A very clean hotel, spacious rooms and comfortable beds. The service was good and the food very nice, my only criticism would be that if you ordered tea / coffee it did not stay hot very long. We were showing at the exhibition centre and didn't even have to leave the hotel grounds to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for trade shows in the word trade centre Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Urs68
Reviews.Content: The hotel is directly connected to exhibition halls at the World Trade Center Dubai. WIthin 5 minutes you are at your booth in the exhibition centre! The rooms in the hotel were very clean and the service personel was friendly and did an excellent job. The breakfast buffet was large and different kind of food was served, however sometimes it was a little bit crowded. The Internet connection (WLAN) in my room was fast for Dubai and login was working without problems. The hotel is at the World Trade Centre which is near the beginning of the Sheik Zahed Road. The hotel can easily be reached by taxi (Airport 15 Minutes) and also the next Dubai Metro station is near. For business purposes I would recommend this hotel. For holliday purposes with the family in Dubai then I would chose another hotel with more atmosphere and more leisure fascilities.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business travellers .”
Reviews.Author: TripleAmama
Reviews.Content: Excellent location if you are attending a conference in the nearby expo & conference centre. Rooms are clean & tidy. Breakfast was good and had a lot of varieties. We ordered room service and it was really good. On the downside, other than the location the hotel does not offer any thing extra . I dont understand why the WiFi is not free though in a hotel that is targeting business travellers!

Reviews.Title: “not recommended for family visit”
Reviews.Author: Khalidsaeed
Reviews.Content: This is pretty ordinary hotel with ordinary facilities. This hotel is overcorwded during the period when exhibition is in porgess in World Trade Centre. If you want to visit dubai during that period for holidays or leisure with your family, just stay away from the hotel. You need taxi even if you want to visit the nearest shops or caffee etc. Monorail connection is available but we did not use it.We checked inn the day when there was last day of one of the exhibitions and it took us long long time to reach the hotel as the road to the hotel was almost jammed with big trucks and lorries This hotel is best suited for exhibitors who are participating in the exhibition.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel and high charge”
Reviews.Author: peter S
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel at the end of February '12. The room was not clean and smelled specially badly. The minibar was locked and could not be used. Despite that, at the hotel reception they wanted to charge me refreshments when checking out. Later, they admitted their error and were kind and polite. Worst of all was the bathroom. It was "specially equiped" for disenabled people. Instead of offering more comfort, it was just the opposite. A part from a dirty plastic curtain,the shower cell was actually not seperated from the bathroom floor and showed a suspliciously small hole for water evacuation. Result: after a short 5 min. shower, the whole bathroom was flooded. It took more then an hour before most of the water was gone. The hotel features a nice swimming pool, which I was going to use at the end of the day: they closed it because some company organised their party at the pool. I must say, hotel staff were friendly at all times. However, my stay was so short, they could not fix any problem within that timeframe. For one night, they charged be close to Eur. 200,- This is the worst quality/price ratio I have ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: AbuHammad
Reviews.Content: If like most tourists visiting Dubai you want to see the glamour and glitz of this city, it's best to stay at the centre of all this, Sheikh Zayed Road. For those that know Dubai's history, know very well that the first ever skyscraper in Dubai, for that mattter the UAE, was the World Trade Centre. Host to many of the most famous exhibitions in the region. This building from the 80s still stands and maintains its value amidst the glamourous steal and glass structures. The convention centre and trade centre is the location of the Novotel I am rating here. The reason for this introduction is to give credence to the hotel's location. And then when you consider that it is central to the current Dubai this location is great. The hotel is 4 stars, breakfast is very nice, rooms are small but considering that most hotels these days are not family friendly forcing a small gentelman's family of four, to take two rooms, this hotel has a wonderful policy which I encourage, they consider kids to be 16 or lower. And the really best part is their room has a double bed and a sofa bed that unfolds to a double bed. The staff are very nice, good service reasonably fast and friendly. The spa is nice, checking in was quite reasonable and check out was really quick. If you rent a car they have a complimentary valet service for guests. Of course the hotel does have one drawback and that is the convention centre next door to it, there are large groups coming to the hotel and it can get intermittently crowded, but since the hotel is well used to this you will not feel anything in the service even the lifts up and down, no hassle. But like I said the crowds may not be your cup of tea, I mean groups of 50 and more signing up in the lobby etc. All in all we liked this hotel and for one more year if we visit we could stay since our kids are getting close to the 16 age limit.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it even for expos”
Reviews.Author: sherif27
Reviews.Content: I stayed here more than 5 times over the past 3 years and only because it was business related and to attend expos. The room rates during expos are such a rip off its not even funny, for that rate you can enjoy a decent 5 star accomodation in Dubai Marina or Diera and be within 10-15 minutes of the expo. Rooms are standard Novotel and if your not used to Novotel standards than its basically a motel 8 quality. Cheap furniture, rocks are softer than their beds and service to match.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: AilsaPerth_Scotland
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here on way to New Zealand. Had memories of Novotel being a budget hotel but this was much more than that and yet was not expensive. The rooms were clean and reasonably sized, the staff very helpful, and breakfast first class. Would definitiely stay here and with Novotel again

Reviews.Title: “Staying at DWTC Novotel Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with nice crew. Nice place to attend exhibition at DWTC. Expensive. Better if Internet is free (however it is AED100/day) Holder of Accor FG Business Card but noticed no discount as promised.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Novotel”
Reviews.Author: jammydodger0905
Reviews.Content: We recently started using this hotel and the feedback has been favourable. This is my first time in this hotel. In usual Novotel fashion, the entrance is grand and inviting, giving the impression of better to come. Peel off the surface and it's the same as every other Novotel around the world. The rooms: I think Mr Novotel must have got a "job lot" of beds from somewhere, because they are as hard as the ones in all his other Novotels! If you don't sleep well on a hard bed, then don't stay here!! The room facilities: It's nice to have tea/coffee in the rooms, the other amenities are the same. Cleanliness was OK. Internet: Luckily for me we get internet included in our contract, it is fast and reliable. Not sure what they charge normally, but I do disagree with over-priced internet! Breakfast. Average. Very very busy with semi-attentive staff, they are constantly on the go so have little time for "customer service"!! Location wise it is excellent. AED15 (£2) in a taxi to the Dubai Mall where you will find everything from designer to basic and plenty of restaurants. The Gold souk is a bit further AED 30 (£5) but always worth a visit if you want good prices and like bartering! Personally I wouldn't stay here through choice, but it is OK for a short visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: AVH12
Reviews.Content: Wonderful property, clean and cosy experience. Ideal location, very close to - monorail, Dubai mall. Also not very far from mall of emirates. Sumptuous breakfast with good spread. Amazing pool to cool you off. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Cosy, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Saniban
Reviews.Content: I went there with an old friend and we found it clean , quiet and comfortable with a fantastic breakfast and good location since its only 5 minutes drive to Dubai Mall and not so far from the mall of Emirates . rooms are not so big ( who cares !) but with a greaaaaaaaaaaaaaaatttttttttttt sleeping quality ... sheets felt soft and smelled greaaaaaaaat :) Mmmmm... After all you are in a Novotel ...

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: WhizfortyKuwait
Reviews.Content: We were there for the weekend. The service was good and a helpful lot at the reception. The breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Asma_10
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was very clean with a pleasant atmosphere. The staff are fantastic and they all spoke English so most people shouldn't have any communication problems. Food choice was good with lots of variety to suit everyone. We hired a car so the location did not bother us too much but those who do not have a car may have a few issues as the metro is not very close to the hotel (and walking in the heat can be terrible but it's Dubai). There a plenty of taxis outside so getting around should not be a problem at all. The pool at the hotel is average sized and there isn't much for those wanting something for the kids to do.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before booking”
Reviews.Author: JaNar
Reviews.Content: After reading all positive and negative reviews regarding Novotel WTC, I have decided to book it for 4 days, due to the fact most of hotels were overbooked. So at the arrival I have showed my hotel voucher (I have booked it from web) to reception. The receptionist started searching for 15 minutes and couldn't find my reservation. I have told her that I have booked and payed for hotel accommodation a week before arrival. After a while I was told that my reservation was not approved and I have to look for another hotel, also the site I have booked through is not reliable (although the website I have booked through most of you guys know). After my threat that I will sue them in court, front office manage came. She has told me the same thing that hotel is overbooked and they can not place me. I have called the hotline number of travel company in order to find out what was the problem. They have told me to stay in hotel and that they will contact directly with Novotel reservation department to fix the problem, and that the payment was sent to Novotel. After waiting 2 hours in lobby, finally they gave me a room in "fully overbooked hotel". How could I get a room in hotel where no free rooms were left? After getting a room, I thought that all problems were solved and I can enjoy my staying. I was wrong. In the morning we came down to have a breakfast. The same story here again, the lady carefully checked the list and asked me "How you wish for paying the breakfast?" I have told them that the room I have booked includes breakfast, by showing her hotel voucher where clearly says that it's included. During the check out the receptionist have told me that I have to pay for hotel room, due to the fact that they haven't received the payment from my travel agency. Of course I refused to pay, claiming I did it already. In other words, I have never seen such a rude and unfriendly stuff anywhere in the world. My advise do not book this hotel and I will tell you what kind of unpleasant surprises you will face. - There is a Blue bar in ground floor, so if you are hoping to sleep quietly, forget about it. Non stop loud music will keep you awake. - Rooms are pretty small, and smelly. I have stayed at Four Points Sheraton Sheikh Zayed Road before, where rooms were much better. - Hotel personnel is so unprofessional. I wonder where they gather all these people. - Breakfast is average. Limited choice of food, and the same stuff everyday. - No free internet even in the lobby. The rates are way to high. Would I recommend this hotel? No, no and no again. There are plenty of good hotels in Dubai with better rates and customer service.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: meg h
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel with very friendly staff. Stayed here several times. Rooms are frequently serviced, nice pool, bar and different restaurants available. Nice area too!! Many thanks to Ms. Dedes, for all the service & hospitality, we definitely would return.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: evaogriseg
Reviews.Content: Good location off Sheikh Zayed Road, next to World Trade Center and close to Emirates Towers and DIFC. The furniture in the rooms is new and modern (nice colors). The choice of food at breakfast is ok. The gym is also well equipped. The staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Dubai”
Reviews.Author: DavidTal Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff except for Front Desk. Dont settle your invoice the night before because they will clean out your mini bar and lock the fridge throwing out any items you may have in there even though they have your credit card details as security. Internet charges are steep so get yourself sorted from the shop at the Etisalat store at the WTC next door. Excellent location and value for money rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: diesssel Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location, Free valet parking, very clean, very satisfying breakfast, friendly staff. You can make free local calls from the lobby, maybe from your room also. Close to Dubai Mall and Burj Khalifa. Value for money massages. but No free wifi

Reviews.Title: “dirty carpet”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location is very good around 200 meters from metro station and 50 meters from bus stop. The Carpet is very dirty and bed and sofabed is not comfortable Supermarket 200 meters from the hotel 60-70 AED from airport to hotel

Reviews.Title: “Basic business hotel, average service”
Reviews.Author: DiploConcierge
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this property, in my view, is it's location. Right next door is a huge convention center. There's a Caffe Nero nearby. You can walk to Dubai Mall and the Burj Khalifa. Sheik Zayed Road and the metro are within close walking distance. The hotel itself was kind of disappointing. It looks modern in the lobby and from outside, but the rooms are a bit tired and decrepit, the bathrooms especially. The staff were mostly unhelpful. The concierge (Cherrie) was singularly unhelpful, expert at telling you what she couldn't do and then offering no alternative suggestions concerning what she could do. It made us wonder if the hotel or she knew what a concierge was. Jenny, at the front desk, was similarly unhelpful and had some attitude. In speaking with her, as with Cherrie, I felt like they lacked a basic understand of customer service. It was as though they believed that customer service was a favor you do for someone and not really their job. They didn't seem inclined to be helpful. Not all of the staff were unhelpful. A lady with short blonde hair, whose name I wish I had asked, was very helpful upon check-in, in answering our many questions about what's nearby and what services the hotel offered. She was based at the Priority desk, but then I didn't see her again during our visit. The other staff were o.k. All in all, though, instead of staying here, I would recommend staying at the nearby Ibis on the other side of the convention center. It's a fraction of the price of the Novotel, and just about as nice in terms of facilities and amenities. Plus, it's closer to Caffe Nero, Sheik Zayed Road and the metro. And the staff seemed much more friendly there (I went over to have a look and inspect rooms.) I wish I had booked there.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not for family with infant”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The service was not that good ,we asked them for babybed but they didn't bring it. Also we couldn't use the refragetor while we need it for the baby food. I think it is maybe a good hotel but not for family with 9 months baby. One more thing the lights in the room are not comefortable enough.

Reviews.Title: “More expensive than ibis but less quality”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very dirty, not satisfied,will never stay in novotel again. But polite receptions and visitor guide. The room was very average with quite dirty curpet. This is a 4 star hotel but i dont think it worth more than three.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Business”
Reviews.Author: Piero8181
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights here back in March 2011, my company was exhibiting at the conference centre which joins on to the hotel so the location was perfect, we could not ask for more. My room was a good size and much better than Novotels I had stayed in around Europe, restaurant and bars were also great with a decent selection of meals and drinks on offer throughout the day and evening. Prices were also very reasonable, unfortunately I did not get the opportunity to try the pool out!! In conclusion, stay here for business and definitely a no brainer if you are using the conference centre!

Reviews.Title: “Novotel WTC Dubai - ideal stopover”
Reviews.Author: PeteWH
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through an Emirates Air stopover package that included transfers, breakfasts etc. The property met all our expectations. One particular "bonus" is its 24-hour check-in policy which was very welcome as we had a 5am arrival at the airport ... We could not fault the Novotel - helpful and obliging staff, excellent room and a very good restaurant. Maybe the only negative for us was that smoking is allowed in the bar. But then I guess we didn't need to drink there! The location was ideal for our two day stopover ... would use again and certainly recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Exhibitions at the WTC”
Reviews.Author: sharkyuae
Reviews.Content: I booked a suite here as I need an additional room for meetings during Arab Health, and the WTC were asking silly money for a small meeting room. Excellent bedroom with bathroom, and the lounge area of the suite was perfect for two days of meetings, great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for a stopover or the Trade Centre”
Reviews.Author: Marko76
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights at the Novotel Dubai World Trade Centre which is connected to the Dubai International Convention and Exhibition Centre with the Dubai Metro also conveniently located near the hotel. You can travel to the Airport, Emirates Towers or Dubai Mall with Burj Khalifa (or 'Mall of Emirates') very easily by taxi or metro. The staff were genuinely friendly, particularly at breakfast, as was the attendant by the pool. An early check-in for myself was accommodated quickly and efficiently. Breakfast was definitely a highlight and can be taken outside by the pool. The gym and pool are superb. Internet connection is available at a cost. There were a few irritating issues however, the water temperature in the shower constantly fluctuated between very hot and cold and the bedrooms are beginning to show their age (a complete contrast to the rest of the hotel). The pillow’s are way past their prime and the carpet needs replacing, particularly in the hallway’s. That aside, It's still a good hotel to stay if attending an event next door or for a stopover.

Reviews.Title: “OK but gone downhill since last stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Check in slow and mini farce with lost booking. Bed v uncomfortable. More faffing with request for a glass of milk from restaurant to take to our room (not allowed). TV didn't work too well and remote was irritating. But location still good. Staff ranging from OK to v good. Clean, reasonable size rooms. On the whole though my conclusion is summed up by the fact that last time we stayed it was cheaper, better and we recommended it to others. This time I would say the opposite for each. Shame as it was a good find, but we won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “very poor towels”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: - I find towels in hotel in very poor quality, it is not suitable for 3 or 4 star hotel. - staff are very good, house keeping are too slow. - they send me broken baby cot and they didn't change it during my whole stay. - very good location for most Dubai trade fairs

Reviews.Title: “nice and easy”
Reviews.Author: chri r
Reviews.Content: This Novo is attced to the trade exhibition center so perfectly located for any fair.All facilities in need and large rooms with leaving area. Nice bar on ground floor called the blue bar. Internet connection available on room charge and my hotmail page was impossible to open...this is my only complain. I'll go back next year for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Dubai trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excelent hotel with a great breakfast that I strongly recomend Could be easier to go to the close downtown Dubai mall, but taxi is so cheap so it doesn't matter. The rooms are comfortable with enough space. Minibar prices are to high (as always)

Reviews.Title: “Best Location-Affordable Price”
Reviews.Author: DeccanCharger
Reviews.Content: Been to Dubai in August.This Hotel is located in the Business district of Dubai.This would be the best location if you are travelling to dubai on a Business Trip.The Breakfast is not too great but manageable.The rooms are not too spacy.For this price and location this would be an ideal hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: dbasha
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 7 nights recently while attending a conference at the Convention Centre. The advantage was convenience, as it is right next door and connected to the Convention Centre. However, the rooms are small and poorly maintained, there are serious hot water issues with the showers, and many of the bell staff are clueless about tourist-related issues, Given that this hotel caters primarily to conference attendees, I was also amazed that they did not even have an i-phone charger available. The business centre costs are also very high. Further, wifi is chargeable at an exorbitant rate. All in all, this hotel is only worth staying at if you are attending conferences next door.

Reviews.Title: “Utilitarian grade Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChillyAlbertans
Reviews.Content: Decided to put the convenience of staying right at the conference center over the quality of the hotel and. Got what I deserved. The hallway and the room smelled of mold, the carpet in the room was very stained. The water temp was a constant issue. I have never been in a hotel where you had to run the water for ten minutes to get to the COLD Water! Without that you had scalding water. The staff seem to work hard to keep an older hotel clean. Our room attendant was excellent. The furnishings are cheap throughout and the bed is rock hard. The linens though we're decent. There is free Internet for guests throughout the hotel. Then there is the food..unless the microwaves a regular part of your culinary regime, this is not good food. Breakfast was the worst, lunch marginally better, we did not risk supper. It is 85 durham per peson and not worth half that. We tried eating supper in the Blue Bar next door, atrocious...we sent both dishes back and refused repeated requests to replace it with more crap. We tried the manhattan strips...overlooked, unseasoned, flavourless strips of a very thin steak. SO ordered the crab cakes...worst ever. The concierge is not a conscience, he/she is merely the bellman who happens to be standing there. Theynhavelittle useful information as it is clear they have no opportunity to go to the places they are trying to recommend. Nice enough, but no useful knowledge. Taxi service is odd. Although the is a hotel sign noting taxis are only for guests, we w told on more than one occasion that taxis we not supposed to stop there. They are supposed to stop at the other end of the conference center and off the property. What an odd situation. It took a long time to get one most times. Beware of the private cars with no meters....mind you some did have meters as we discovered on one occasion where the trip was almost three times the cost of the return trip. Sometimes the hotel staff will check for you whe. The taxi pulls up, but not,always. The hotel is close to the metro and we took that when we could. Clean, fast and well run. Pay the big buck and ride gold...I think the price difference was about 3 dirhams each way. I doubt I would stay here again, but other conference attendees assured mt that the connected Ibis is far worse.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ashishmehra
Reviews.Content: During my last visit to Dubai, i stayed at the Novotel World Trade Centre. I normally stay at the Meridien but this time decided to stay at Novotel as it was conveniently located close to Jumeirah Towers where I had work. Upon arrival, out pick up was nowhere to be seen. I had to make a call to the hotel to ask whether he was there at all. Finally, he arrived and apologised. The checkin was extremely slow and a painful experience. It us almost 35 minutes to complete the formalities. The air conditioning was pathetic to say the least. I complained and the engineer arrived to check and said that nothing could be done. The temperature was stagnant at 25 degrees and would not budge. They changed my room to the one next door. Before shifting, i asked the maintenance to check and make sure the cooling was working fine. They said it was. 20 minutes later i was on the phone with the duty manager complaining about the air conditioning. Another room change at 3 am and this one thankfully was fine. The staff was helpful and courteous but that was about it. Dont think i will stay here again even though I visit Dubai quite frequently.

Reviews.Title: “Sure i will visit this hotel gain when i need to go to trade center”
Reviews.Author: YoYoRiffa
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel.. its clean but service at reception was slow. The location is perfect for world trade center. its quiet and neat. The breakfast buffet was good.. lots of varieties.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: VinnyGerard
Reviews.Content: If you are in town for an exhibition at the World Trade Center, look no further. The hotel is mere footsteps away from the expo halls. Also, you only have to walk thru the WTC main hall (about 200 meters) to get to the metro station. The hotel itself is not luxurious like some other options you have in Dubai, but the quality of the services provided is very good. Very good breakfast including an omelet serving station. Reasonably sized room and bathroom. Good pool and fitness center. Good but expensive wi-fi (100 dirhams/day). Hotel restaurant was just okay, not many dining options and the steak is overcooked, make sure to order rare to medium-rare. Room service was fast enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service in all areas”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff efficient at front desk, bellboy welcoming and quick to attend to our luggage. Room very clean although slight smell of smoke when we had requested a non-smoking room. Breakfast buffet good selection and waiter staff very good. Chefs were also pleasant and quick to cook items for us. Decor and ambience very pleasing in all areas. Dinner menu varied and meal beautifully presented. Staff would attend to our needs immediatley before we knew we needed anything ! As I had a broken arm the senior staff member immediately offered to obtain a cushion for my comfort, which was greatly appreciated. Wake up call was right on time and check out receptionist and bellboy most efficient. Only negative item was that the towels were very thin and small so possibly need replaced.

Reviews.Title: “Dubai Stopover”
Reviews.Author: tiger96_nz
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, very helpful. Comfortable and clean. Free shuttle service pickup to The Mall of Dubai right outside the hotel. The only think we could fault them for was we had arrange a pickup at the airport and couldn't find them.

Reviews.Title: “Not for tourists! Dissapointed in both hotel and Dubai.”
Reviews.Author: Jenw13
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 night at the end of Sept 2011. This is a hotel for business travellers/people. Theres a conference centre next door so alot of people seemed to be there for that. Room was basic, TV remote never worked, no internet and its not a relaxing hotel. You have to get taxis everywhere as its in the business district and we had a poor view of building work. Staff where OK but not brilliant. Once you did'nt tip I felt your cards where marked. We always go with the majority on trip advisor but was really dissapointed with this hotel. Would advise to stay near the Dubai Fountains or Dubai Marina.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a stopover stay !”
Reviews.Author: W-Voyager-128
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights during a stopover and enjoyed my stay. Very good service from staff and good breakfast that was included in the room price. Rooms not very big but sufficient and beds were comfortable. Decent swimming pool. Location is good and close to Dubai Mall. Short ride with the taxi or you could even walk if you fancy that, not recommended during hot months. It is also a short ride from the airport so perfect for a stopover stay. Taxi’s are cheap in Dubai. The only negative is that there is no free internet ! Would stay again if we go to Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy business friendly hotel in the heart of Dubai”
Reviews.Author: qb76
Reviews.Content: It was the choice of our company tour operator and while I was visited the hotel many times while living in Dubai for over two years, never had the opportunity to stay in it. A decent business hotel that is just 10 minutes away from all major attractions. While in one direction, you have the opportunity to see tallest tower in the world, Burj Khalifa & World biggest Mall, Dubai Mall. In other, you can experience the old Dubai. Rooms are spacious and clean. Buffet breakfast in the lobby is ok. Quantity and variety has been preferred over quality. Taxis are easy to get & if you happen to there in spring/winter, you can infact walk to nearest metro station. Hotel has a well-known Jazz Bar and one lounge called Lotus. In a city where hotel choices are huge, I would still prefer Novotel due to it s close proximity to both new and old dubai.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: cxahmed
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 days and it was a nice experience. The hotel room was not that big but enough. In my package the breakfast was included and it was very good and tasty. A good mix between the Arab and the Western style. It is walking distance to a park where you can relax and also walking distance (20 min) to Dubai Mall. Generally, a good hotel that live up to what they promise and what they show in their pictures on their homepage. One disturbing thing, however, is the Internet. It is not free, and it is really expensive. I think I payed 10€ for an hour. Also the connection was really poor. However, generally I was satisfied and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Next to Trade Center , overused!”
Reviews.Author: Brazukajo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel a few times, last time I stayed for over 15 nights, throught a good deal made at the counter of Destinations of The World upon arrival in Dubai Airport terminal 1 , US 80 per night tax inclusive. Two were my main complaints, overused towels and the fact you have to wait a lot until the vallet service brings your car, that you are not allowed to park. For this kind of rate it is a good hotel. I would come back again only on the same rate. Expensive internet!

Reviews.Title: “As good as any 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: mags28116
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on way back from an extended trip to Thailand and Australia. We had stayed at a luxurious 5 star on last trip but opted for a cheaper option and didn't regret it. Hotel offered room service (reasonably priced), nice pool and poolside restaurant, bar, restaurant, coffee shop. Staff very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Weintime1 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, staff very attentive. Breakfast was good value and quality. The restaurant was good for dinner and was affordable. Rooms were clean...Internet should be included in the tariff in this day and age....we traveled through Europe for 8 weeks and every where we stayed had free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & quite rooms”
Reviews.Author: Iraqi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good for business trips as it is close to Dubai World trade center and the stocks market and other business attraction, but it will be big disappointment for tourists as it is far from the down town and you will need an expensive taxi trip to reach any interest part of the city. The hotel itself is small but it is clean, quiet and has a nice restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay - family friendly”
Reviews.Author: Roostern78
Reviews.Content: We had 3 wonderfull nigths in Novotel. Friendly staff and good service. Nice pool area. The internet is a bit expensive

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: OrchiBaby
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff and helpful all the time, nice business oriented hotel located at the trade center as you can access to it indoor, the room is nice and have all the basic requirements clean bath room and comfortable seating area. not the best view however overall was pleasant and enjoyed staying for one night…

Reviews.Title: “I walked out”
Reviews.Author: Marce1111
Reviews.Content: Rooms very simple, and not spacious, total eurpean feel, minus the euro-flare! I booked a non-smoking room. My room smelled like smoke. I called the reception and asked to be moved to another room. A staffer came with a spray bottle with some pink stuff and sprayed the room right infront of me inclusive of my luggage! I went down and expelained to the front desk that that would not solve my problem, because I am allergic and I would not be able to sleep. they suggested trying a few rooms - as if they were not sure which rooms were smoke free. I checked out. They still charged me one nights worth but I slept great elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “not bad but not par with expectations”
Reviews.Author: vivekkmehta
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in more than 15 hotels in Dubai in various areas and various seasons, the bar has been raised obviously. This recent visit I have decided to stay in Novotel WTC, and found that hotel is extremely well managed, neat and claen, meeting all 4* properties but still not reaching the high standards other hotels has achieved in the area. There are issues like, wireless connectivity problem could not get fixed as their IT manager was not available in the hotel, Communication with reception staff was not the best, toiletries were not sufficiently provided. Irons were not readily available in the room etc. Except these issues the place is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a stop-over”
Reviews.Author: BossLadyDarwen
Reviews.Content: We took a chance and booked a Mystery hotel . We got the novotel and it suited our stay. We stayed 3 nights en-route to to Delhi. Our room was quite small but comfortable .On the plus side the breakfast was very good with lots of choices ,the Blue bar did good bar snacks and had happy hour which made us happy. The hotel is situated about 20mins from the airport and taxi fares are very cheap. We booked an evening dinner cruise on the creek for about £20.00pp and a city tour for about the same which were both very good . The small pool area was quite a pleasant to sit outside.

Reviews.Title: “Nice with some disadvantages”
Reviews.Author: Alqasimk Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in good location for conferences. But the rooms are outdated, tiny, bed uncomfortable and the double bed room bed was very small for 2 person! and when we request to make it a twin bed room they insisted not to change it as this is our booking for our rate! even that the same rate was for double or twin bed! and even that I tried to make an online booking after the request and it shows availible double bed with the same rate... I guess that the staff are too lazy to honor clients requests.. this is a very bad for big name chain.. price point of view the price is not special compared to the service and room u get but with the same price or like 10% extra in Dubai u can get a better, more modern, bigger room in another hotel chain..

Reviews.Title: “Novotel WTC - Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very friendly hotel with qualified personnel. Breakfast buffet is fantastic and diner at "entre nous" was excellent. Blue Bar is cosy. Rooms are well maintained but would need some lifting. the big advantage of the hotel is to be in the WTC.

Reviews.Title: “I found a tick in the bed”
Reviews.Author: VeronicaC19
Reviews.Content: I had a conference inside this hotel hence I decided to stay there for the entire staying. I foud a tick in the bed. They moved me to another room when I told them so, and the manager and all the people around me for this issue were very nice. Anyway, I was nervous all time long because of being afraid of the presence of other ticks. On Thursday nights the hotel gives a party, this means that if you have (as I did) a room on the pool side you can't sleep or work. In this case they moved me to another room again. Wi-fi internet is present but NOT complimentary. Basically they were nice all the time and in responding to problems, but there were way too many problems for me. 6 days, 3 rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Option”
Reviews.Author: MrAshish
Reviews.Content: We travelled with a large group and also had a conference at the hotel. Rooms although not very large are adequate and more importantly extremely clean. Service otherwise is average. Taxi availability is limited and can be a challenge sometimes. Very close to the new part of dubai and ideal if you want to take in the new malls around dubai.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: shahram99j Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I will not come back to this hotel , I have never seen that before !! The minibar was locked and you have to pay deposit to open it . The rooms are very small and very bad odor .The staff were very helpful

Reviews.Title: “A thoroughly enjoyable visit”
Reviews.Author: Globaltraveller55
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive at the reception I would get on my arrival, as I was delayed and had asked the hotel to arrange for a car to pick me up at the terminal. I need not have worried my driver, ever patient, was still waiting. Despite the early hour, I was given a great welcome and shown to my room, a superior double on 12th floor. Though I am familiar with Novotels, I felt this particular hotel had more in common with a Sofitel.The ground floor was elegant and well staffed.During my 3 day stay, I enjoyed lighter dishes in the Cafe, refreshment and food by the pool, meals in the bar and dinner in the a la carte restaurant which also offered an extensive hot buffet with International Cuisine.On one evening, I enjoyed live entertainment in the Blue Bar.The business centre enabled me to book my onward flight on line and the concierge team arranged taxis to see the sights around Dubai and sightsee on the Big Bus Tour which proved most enjoyable.A great start to the holiday, the hotel arranged for a Lexus to drop me off at the terminal for a very reasonable fee.

Reviews.Title: “Great service; average rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The people are very helpful. Good location. For an executive room I had expected more then 'just' additional wifi and a coffee machine. Towels not always clean. ***************************************************************************************

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok, Good Location for Business”
Reviews.Author: CJS07
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel for the business traveller, location is right next to the Trade Center, however I found the rooms to be very sparse and basic ie no frills, the beds were very hard although when my colleague asked them to replace her matress they moved her to a different room with a softer bed. Unless you are here for work, I would not recommend this hotel as it is far away from everything (malls, beach, etc) however it was always easy to get a taxi so if you do have meetings that you can walk to from the hotel, it's not a bad place to go. Buffet jbreakfast ust ok and very expensive!

Reviews.Title: “This is really a very good 3* hotel and not 4*”
Reviews.Author: AryanaToronto
Reviews.Content: +Good hotel, great location. They might in fact be taking too much advantage of the fact that they are right next door to the expo halls. - This is really a 3* hotel. The rooms are pretty average. Just OK bed and pillow. Toileteries are a real minus (which 4* hotel have you seen that doesn't supply conditioner and body lotion????!!!). There is only cheap shampoo and soap. Add a shower cap and this is all you get as far as toileteries. There was also no iron and ironing board in the room. When I called for it, they brought it readily however the ironing board was really tired and had burnt marks all over it. The iron was also old and leaked a little. +The lobby, resto&breakfast are first rate. +The internet was high speed wifi and it worked well. All in all, I stayed here because it was walking distance to DIFC where I had business to do for a week. Next time, I will look for better deals which would justify what the value really is. Lastly, try to get a deal including breakfast. It was great :) AND AND AND ask for the Emirates towers view which is simply fantastic if you care about view.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very good value for money for this location”
Reviews.Author: dicknharry
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased at this hotel, which is in a completely different league from other chains, such as Ibis (next door), in fact it does not feel like part of a chain at all. Complimentary valet parking, welcoming and efficient (though slow, as we arrived at a busy time) check-in and a clean comfortable room. Genuinely friendly and obliging staff at all levels. Big, bright dining area, great buffet breakfast with plenty of choice and eggs cooked to order. Even though there is no pork, "turkey bacon" (actually much leaner) and chicken sausages are available! Attracts a cosmopolitan clientele, young and old, with a mixture of business people and tourists, also used by airline crew, including pilots. Very relaxing leisure facilities, including a lovely outdoor swimming pool and steam rooms in the spacious, separate changing areas for men and women - very quiet when we were there. Not really worth hiring a car in Dubai if you are not leaving the city, as (without SAT-NAV) you can quickly take a wrong turn, even with a decent map - the traffic is very fast and the roads have many lanes. Turning back in the opposite direction usually involves taking a U-turn, as in the US. Similarly, few people walk very far. Do not try to walk from the hotel to the Burj Khalifa as we did. The entrance is inside the Dubai Mall, you will find it more easily if you take a taxi there. Taxis are very cheap. There is also a highly efficient (and like everything in Dubai, new) metro and it is very easy to get the metro direct from the airport to the Trade Centre station and then get a taxi on to the hotel (not far away, but too far to walk with luggage). The only thing I would really fault is that free Internet is not available at the hotel, at least not without wifi - not sure if this was free as we did not bring a laptop. We had to pay about the equivalent of £5 (can't remember exactly how many dirhams), minimum charge, to use the Internet in the hotel's Business Centre for 2 1/2 hours, without the option of being able to spread this time over several visits, quite frustrating as we just wanted to check email.

Reviews.Title: “A big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: meezfit
Reviews.Content: I am glad we only booked a night there. It was enough.. The front desk took a long time to check us in. Claiming they didn't receive a fax from the website that we had booked from. Upon entering the room we discovered that they had not set up the sofa bed for the kids, so we called up the housekeeping service and told them that we were on our way out for dinner, but would like them to prepare the sofa bed for the kids so when we return it would be ready for them to sleep on. 4 hours later when we came back from dinner, nothing was prepared. The shower mixer didn't work properly, you either had very hot water or very cold water. It was very hard to give the kids a proper shower. The air-condition stopped working in the middle of the night...it was as if the whole system was switched off. We never had AC back on. It was very stuffy in the morning when the sun shone into the room and the windows couldn't be opened. We checked out of the hotel as soon as we could.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms and a lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: slc_45
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely stay and an enjoyable experience at the novotel. The staff were friendly and helpful. We arrived early in the morning and they did their best to get us a room as early as possible, which we were very grateful for after a long flight. We did not have breakfast their everyday but when we did it was nicely done and there was a lot of choice. The rooms were lovely and spacious with good room amenities. We also had a lovely view from our room especially at night . The pool was clean and of a decent size. This hotel is perfect for business travellers who need to be near the financial centre and the trade centre. Even though it isn't the best of location it was easy to get a taxi anytime of day . Overall a really pleasant stay and would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel World Trade Centre”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good size room, comfortable, carpet a bit stained, useful location near airport and metro station. Plenty of nearby cafes etc, as well as hotel facilities.

Reviews.Title: “good stay with good company, good service and great food!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: services by concergie and porters were excellent. very speed of service. Everyone friendly and very approachable. room service was excellent, fast and effiecent. beds were comfortable although our bathroom was alittle too small and boxed in. waiters at resturant need to learn food menus and have knowledge of food and wine for foreigners. housekeeping was thorough and very effiencent. Overall the stay was very good, would definitely stay there again, pref with city view and a larger room type. thank you

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for the show”
Reviews.Author: Fintan62 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a Show at the Dubai Expo and this hotel is ideally located with in the exhibition complex with good links to the city and resort. Good value for money when considered to hotel prices in Dubai

Reviews.Title: “Novotel World Trade Centre Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very pleasent stay, the rooms are a good size, well appointed with everything you'll need for either long or short stay. The staff are helpful and kind. The hotel is well positioned for excellent shopping at either Dubai Mall or Mall of the Emirates, both only minutes away. The pool is safe and clean, with excellent services. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Convienient location and good rooms”
Reviews.Author: Lubelu2
Reviews.Content: We had an over night stay in dubai on our way to Italy and the hotel served it purpose. The front desk were pleasant but very slow. The bar was nice and there was a happy hour. They were happy to organize a day trip or us and the breakfast was nice and plentiful. Overall a nice place to stay but the rooms were not too glamourous.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly simple and convenient”
Reviews.Author: ZED2010
Reviews.Content: The location is not the best of the city but if you have business in the immediate area, it is the one to choose. Fairly quiet, clean, nothing special but no complaints ... the lobby bar is cozy and convenient for drink with colleagues after work. The average mark is only because nothing special to say more ...

Reviews.Title: “WTC”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Ideal location for business and leisure. Activities in World Trade Center can be combined with beach holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Abhijith_J
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Dubai for Official Work . I was travelling from London back to India via Dubai. I normally stay at Novotel in Dubai. I was at Novotel for the first time in August 2008 for an official event for the company I use to work for, and since then I love the place. Especially, it is preferable if you are an vegetarian since the complimentary breakfast buffet which is served includes lots of veggie stuff and you can survive on it for the day till you get back to the hotel. One more good point is you have absolutely awesome view from the rooms and you can have a pleasant night sleep. Definitely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal accommodation.”
Reviews.Author: BMW70
Reviews.Content: The hotel suited us fine. Very well appointed. Friendly and helpful concierge. A lovely atmosphere in the lounge and cafe area. Everything worked as it should. Very comfotable. The hotel is not near the malls but there is public transport available nearby. Take a stroll through the International Exhibition Centre where there is a cafe and four or five other shops. When you reach the other end that is where you will find the 'Metro' public transport. Very easy to get to the malls. The Dubai Mall features a water fall and an ice skating rink. The Mall of the Emirates has a real snow ski slope. 3°c inside and 44°c outside. The whole of Dubai was just great. I am pleased we included it on our round the world holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for exhibition at WTC”
Reviews.Author: rayu66
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of two at the exhibition center and therfore perfectly located. If you experienced the taxi situation in Dubai and you will love this if you exhibit at the World-Trade-Center exhibition center. The rooms are nothing special, but good value for money. If you want it, make sure you get a non.smoking room, they seem to be limited. Good inhouse restaurant with big buffet.

Reviews.Title: “DUBAI CONFERENCE”
Reviews.Author: chicagoflighty
Reviews.Content: Rooms were nice size and very clean. Breakfast was delicious. Bar & Coffee bar were a wonderful place to unwind. Near World Trade Center. View of the Persian Gulf from my room. Service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: JerryVenice
Reviews.Content: Big and clean rooms, good service, good (but too expensive!) breakfast. The hotel is located about 20-25 minutes by car from downtown (I suggest to stop public taxis and not to take the private taxis which waits for you outside the hotel). The staff is very kind and they help you in organizing your tours along the Emirates. There is a nice small swimming pool where you can take the sun in the morning (in December you find about 30°C) and a small fitness area. Wifi Internet connection is available but it is not free.

Reviews.Title: “Like always: Novotel for families is best choice”
Reviews.Author: Alexander025
Reviews.Content: Although tempted by the special offers of Atlantis hotel and Jumeirah Beach hotel, I was happy that I choose (once again) for the Novotel: - Value cannot be beaten; - You always need a taxi in Dubai, so why not take one from the Novotel; - Plenty of space; - No time waiting for check in/out/breakfast etc - Restaurant matches the restaurants of Atlantis and Jumeirah (which we have also tried) So for our family with teenagers, there is no competitive offer in Dubai: Just go and take your room at the Novotel and take a taxi to the waterparks (and even with full entry prices you will be better off !). Even the swimmingpool was OK for your daily dip in the pool, with enough shade, and with few people in the pool the staff were ready to serve you a nice drink. Room for improvement: Yes, the worldcup soccer was not on tv in the Nopvotel but in the nearby Ibis, but this was in the bar where they didnot alow my son opf 16 to come in and watch the match!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jason093
Reviews.Content: Just came back after staying 4 Nights at the Novotel. I was a bit apprehensive after reading previous comments, but would have to say that as this was a business trip this more than met my needs. Have to agree rooms not large but adequate enough for my length of stay. Ideally located for the DIFC which was about a 10-15 minute walk (at a cooler time of year !) 5 minute walk to the nearest metro staion where from there you could explore Dubai. Would I stay there again-Yes I would sums it up. There are probably better Hotels in Dubai, but probably not at the price Novotel Charges

Reviews.Title: “Found it ok to stay, if better if availble could be compared and decide.”
Reviews.Author: aghazali
Reviews.Content: Did not find amazing to describe about this hotel. If found with good rate, I would recommend but not necessarily it should only be the choice. It is quite close to worl trade center and make it more comfortable if you are going to visit the conference or seminar at this places. Then it is one the best choice. I would recommond to keep its evironment bit high compared to others when it comes to high standard, it should not be ignored.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Novotel World Trade Centre Dubai”
Reviews.Author: IoanaC3
Reviews.Content: Great spacious rooms, very clean, best view ever,the most amiable personnel i've ever met, excellent cuisine, lovely pool....What more can I say!? I fell in love with it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: ROLLERS
Reviews.Content: Everything was first class from the moment we arrived. We arrived around 10am and knew check in wasn't until 2pm. We had booked 2 rooms, one of the rooms was ready and we were given the key so we could leave our luggage in and have a shower after our long flight. The staff were so polite and couldn't do enough for us. We used the free hotel shuttle bus to the Mal and the beach. We also used taxies from the hotel which were so cheap. The bedrooms were excellent, lovely and comfortable and really clean. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok business hotel with good concierge and gym/pool”
Reviews.Author: didier_sept
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small and with no charm but are adapted for business, good wifi, large desk... Very good gym and Pool, really surprising for a hotel this class Location is very convenient Service is decent Kamal the concierge proved very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Disppointing Experience. Definitely not "Business Traveler" oriented as they pretend”
Reviews.Author: Raphael T
Reviews.Content: Hotel located next to the World Trade Center, so it is convenient if you attend/participate to an exhibition next door. Otherwise, strictly nothing walking distance around the hotel. Rooms are really standard without any charm/style. Ok for an overnight stay but not for several days. Internet is a complete rip-off as they charge very expensive per day. That is definitely NOT a business attitude. Reception and Business Center are very slow to respond to inquiries. Staff very cold

Reviews.Title: “OK, but lots of other places are better”
Reviews.Author: canswiss
Reviews.Content: Novotel's are usually a good option for a good quality hotel, but this one needs to improve. I was here a year ago, and at the time the service was much more professional, the people more friendly, and there was a free airport shuttle... I get the impression that tough economic times are destroying moral at the Novotel. I checked in on Friday night, the lobby was noisy from the pounding music of the nightclub - which was empty. The next morning the breakfast buffet was very acceptable, but it was also quiet. In a large hotel, when there are not so many people about, it makes the atmosphere feel a little strange. The room was fine and clean, the bed hard but comfortable, but the doors are thin and there seemed to be alot of noise in the hall late at night. The lights have all be changed to the new energy efficient lightbulbs - normally a good idea, but it would be nice to have one light in the room that isn't super bright with cold blue light. On checkout - the desk staff had made an error in my bill that took ages and an assistant manager to correct, it made me question the level of training of the staff. In conclusion,... the hotel is fine, but - if you get as good a price- there are many other places in Dubai at the moment that are nicer and seem to be willing to work harder to get your business. From my experience the Novotel Dubai doesn't seem to think it needs to try very hard at the moment.

Reviews.Title: “most pathetic place for a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: HongKongYzd
Reviews.Content: very small rooms with torn furniture and furnishings.. absolute dump. only good thing was the valet parking. room service is over priced and the hotel is just aging faster than its upkeep. We stayed there for 3 nights and will hopefully never go there again. there is no free internet and wifi is outrageously expensive. concerige desk does not know directions or attractions. food is terrible.. - a traveller from Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: roxy51
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, good clean hotel. Rooms and bathroom were on the small side, wasnt much too the swimming pool, definetly not the place to stay with young kids. But a very good location to explore the city from, the Dubai mall is really near, the old town not far.

Reviews.Title: “Very Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scottishperson
Reviews.Content: Just back from Dubai with 3 nights at this hotel and a seven night cruise. I stayed in a 5 star beach hotel last year and although the Novotel was not as plush, it was great in the fact that it was very central. The room was very large with large TV, plenty of light, good comfy bed, and a substantial breakfast. On the last day before coming home we sunbathed on the very comfy sunbeds, and had sandwiches from the pool bar, which had plenty of filling and came with chips for 42 Dirhams (around £8.00) We took a taxi to Dubai Mall (fantastic) and it was around 17 Dirhams. There is a shuttle bus but we used this once and it took 1 hour 15 mins as it went from hotel to hotel. In a taxi it takes about 10 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for first time visit”
Reviews.Author: TimeOut_10
Reviews.Content: I would really recommand this hotel to everyone who visits Dubai! The hotel lobby is very nice, they have a great jazz bar with happy hour between 5 & 7 (excellent for Dubai, cause alcohol is very expensive) and free buses to the Dubai Mall, Jumeirah beach. The swimming pool is nice and quiet (because there a lot of business travellers in this hotel) and offers free towels. Breakfast is very nice. We had a great room with a view on the Emirates towers and Burj Kalifa! We enjoyed from a promo tariff on their website because we booked some time in advance. So we really got good value for money. Very friendly staff, apart from the guys at reception, bit disappointed by them.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Gracie_in_JHB
Reviews.Content: Comfortable hotel with nice pool area and average sized rooms. We had a room with a king bed and sofa - nicely decorated but not anything to rave about. Bathrooms were not the greatest - I hate the shower in a tub concept and this is what they had. Service was good, and food was nice. Good room service menu with lots of variety. Internet access was expensive, but at least the hotel has free buses to Dubai Mall, Mall of the Emirates and Jumerah beach.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Do1too
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here and found the service excellent in all aspects. Called room service for linen for the pullout bed, they arrived within 5 minutes and quickly made the bed up. Then had to call them about an hour later as we couldn’t open the pull out bed, again they arrived promptly then cheerfully and efficiently solved the problem. The quality and variety at the breakfast buffet was very good with a chef on hand to cook your eggs to your request. The evening meals were also good with a choice of buffet or al la Carte. The front of house staff were helpful and polite. The hotel is located about 10 minutes drive from Dubai mall / Burj Dubai (15-20 uaed in a taxi) and about 20 mins from the airport (70 uaed in a taxi). The airport - hotel shuttle bus service seems to have been discontinued. Taxis were plentiful and good value but try to use the beige colour metered ones rather than the ‘private hire’ cars usually found outside the hotels which are slightly more expensive. There are courtesy buses to most of the malls but check the times, as they are not very frequent although seemingly reliable. Now for the negatives. Our room was small but adequate with all of the features one would expect, the fixtures and fittings were starting to become a little tired and I would say that the room would be ready for a renovation within 12–18 months. This was not a problem though as the standard of cleanliness was very good. Evening bar service in the restaurant was “interesting”. If you order a pint, check that that is what you are served, not a half pint. This happened to me four times and the waiters could not seem to understand the difference, no matter how much I tried to explain. In their defence I will say that the missing measures were eventually (and seemingly reluctantly) served even if the mistake was not admitted. The positives far outweigh the minor negatives and we would definitely use this hotel again. I would rate it a 3 star hotel with 5 star service. The location suited us, I just wish we had booked a longer stay!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Nickat711
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my young family and found this hotel to be quite good. Nice quiet location with very clean and comforable rooms. No complaints at all. Staff very friendly and helpful and breakfast was sensational.

Reviews.Title: “only location near world trade center makes sense!”
Reviews.Author: cobparty
Reviews.Content: So I went there because of his position next to world trade center where i had a exhibition... otherwise forget about this adress... I made my reservation by Expedia offering a suite for less than 200$ per night including breakfast! When I arrived at 5:30am they gave me a room on 3rd floor with view on a wall... then after asking change to a top floor room but smoking.... talking about suite... there are no suite in this hotel!!! SO be careful with information given by expedia!

Reviews.Title: “An O.K Hotel”
Reviews.Author: faiq8
Reviews.Content: this hotel is a good hotel for value of money, i got a very good rate. the room was clean and the bathroom too but the bathroom looks a little old but dont worry nothing disturbing. the room and bathroom are a bit small. t.v got some great channels the room service isn't very fast but the staff are friendly Specially "Dany" in the reception and internet isn't free. for me i will come back to this hotel if i have a limited budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Business Trips ONLY!”
Reviews.Author: falmalki
Reviews.Content: Fine hotel in good location near the hot area in Dubai business-wise. Good service and the best breakfast buffet you can ask for. Very nice nightlife and good facilities. The staff are very welcoming and helpful. However, very very tight and small rooms with not that much of views. The food they serve during the day is not first in class, though!

Reviews.Title: “Value formoney”
Reviews.Author: nrajpur
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, but the hotel is an excellent value for money. The staff is helpful and rooms are clean. Excellent business hotel in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Dubai”
Reviews.Author: rajivgupta69
Reviews.Content: Novotel is a 4 star hotel. I will recommend only if you get a value tariff from the website. The only thing I like about the hotel is it's location. It is bang opposite Sheikf Zaiyed Road and only can see the beautiful Emirates Tower Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Worldglobetrotters
Reviews.Content: Changed to this hotel after moving from the IBIS and we were so pleased we did. We had a king size room which was lovely. A substantial size with king size bed which was so comfortable. Good quality linen with good pillows. TV, mini bar, bed settee, work station, internet connection, phone, tea/coffee. The bathroom wasn't huge but it was very clean with all the amenities you could wish for including a lovely shower. Our room attendant could not have been more acccommodating and kept the room spotless. We wanted to go to the beach and as there were no beach towels he made sure we had surplus quantities of bath towels to take with us. We used the cafe for afternoon snacks which were of good quality with a wide selection of food available including the most scrumptious cakes. There is pool with loungers and a business centre should you wish to use the internet. The staff there are very helpful. The only downside to this hotel is that it is valet parking only and whilst the staff are very quick and efficient, there are times when you have only popped back to the hotel for a very short time but there is nowhere to leave the car and it has to be parked. We found the location of this hotel to be ideal. You are about 30 minutes from The Palm and the same from The Souk. There is a shuttle bus to/from the hotel which arrives at the hotel at 30 minutes past the hour at hotel shuttle stand 2 and leaves for the airport on the hour. It does not have to be pre-booked. There are also shuttles to the beach and to the malls. Taxis are expensive with a trip to the Palm from the hotel about £24 return - you can hire a car for £19 per day. Also the beach the hotel bus takes you to isn't the best, the free one is beautiful and I believe called Jumeirah Beach. Do check that you can take photographs on the beach as there are a lot of signs that say you can't and also if you use the beach the bus takes you too, there is a sign that says Mondays are for ladies only - I cannot confirm that this is correct as we used the free beach on the Monday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money by Dubai standards”
Reviews.Author: aviator1945
Reviews.Content: Stayed here five nights while on a business trip to the Gulf area. Excellent value for money by Gulf standards, although the wifi internet was bit pricey. Free airport pick-up and drop-off. Courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “Exactley what you need”
Reviews.Author: Lameece
Reviews.Content: Having been to Dubai so many times, and spending alot of money on the 5* hotels on every trip... This time i thought i will try for a cheaper dealer so I can have extra spending money in Dubai. I was Apprehensive at first.. On arrivalit was AMAZING clean and neat and the size is great... i would defintely go bk again. The staff were amazing and arrange day trips for you on request. Felt very safe and at home... food great pool nice... I look forward in going bk again....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ANG1970
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, in September 08. We arrived really early but they let us have our room at 9.00am in the morning. There was a courtesy bus to the beach and Emirites Mall. The bus driver was really helpful we had not got any money out at the airport so he drove us in the bus to the nearest ATM machine. The room was top class for the money we paid with a reasonable view around the city. The room was very clean with a good amount of complementry coffee and water. There is a neat little washing line that pulled out over the bath so you could do a bit of washing and hang it to dry. The breakfast which was included in the room price was excellent with everything you could think of been served. Would definitely stay there again if I went back to dubai

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous staff, an ideal location for a short stay in Dubai!”
Reviews.Author: the_travelling_bug_7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Novotel with 2 girlfriends last month and it was everything that we needed. Ok, the view from our window was one of a building site, but also fabulous views of the Emirates Towers and Burj Dubai which easily cancelled the rest out! We chose the bed and breakfast option and can say that the food is also very good with a wide choice of options. The location was great too, Dubai is a big place so it's impossible to be close to everything, but the business district is right in the middle between old and new Dubai so a great base from which to explore. By far the best thing about this hotel however is the wonderful staff who couldn't do enough for us, whether that be flagging down taxis, calling lifts and even putting our fresh laundry in our wardrobes for us! I would highly reccommend the Novotel World Trade Centre for a short stopover and I will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “good location for business”
Reviews.Author: martino72
Reviews.Content: this hotel has a perfect location for business trips considering traffic jams in Dubai. Short distance from airport and Burj Dubai area. It is stylish and essential like all the Novotel hotels and prices are normally reasonable for Dubai area. Restaurant is very good and jazz bar is classy for swinging after dinner. Maybe it is not suitable for tourists because of small swimming pool and far distance from the beaches. Anyway every time i go to Dubai i stay there.

Reviews.Title: “just what we were looking for...!great!”
Reviews.Author: crisfeatharou
Reviews.Content: we stayed 5nights at the novotel world trade centre my husband and I for christmas 2008!we arrived early and we had a room earlier and the check out also was change for us to enjoy our last day in dubai and without any charges, thanks to the reception!! very simple but clean and nice rooms, the hotel as a good location (equal distance from jumeirah, deira, dubailand....) ,the size of the pool is enough for the guests and the workers are very helpful and friendly!! we will definitely go back there next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great again ......”
Reviews.Author: OmanRob
Reviews.Content: Once again we enjoyed the Novotel, we stayed last weekend where we booked a suite and friends booked an interconnecting room - great setup for two families with young kids, put kids to bed then relax in the living room Plus + Valet parking, quick easy and free + Price 995 dhs for suite inc taxes and breakfast + Room, great living room with comfy dining suite and sofa bed + Toilet in living room stops bothering kids + Very quick service for maid service + Pool is fine but was too cold weather to use + Location is great for either taxi or car - very central + Functional clean and genreally nice modern rooms - nothing fancy but thats a nice change for Dubai Minus - Crap hollow fibre small pillows - square and too soft and no feather ones - breakfast - no pork and great selection but quality pretty average - was better last time I stayed Well done again Novotel, I've stayed in about 15 hotels in Dubai in the last 5 years and the Novotel remains my cheap fave - they seem to have accepted the credit crunch effects early and have already reduced rates to less than summer (low season) so bag a bargain. My faves btw Family weekend / holiday - Jumeirah Beach club room, wild wadi access and kids club, great restaurant choice Expensive business or romantic weekend - Emirates Towers - always impresses and the club has free drinks and snacks 24 hrs Cheap business - Novotel rules closely followed by Ibis round the back if you don't want a pool Rob

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller2401
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently and overall, quite affordable compared to many other hotels. The hotel is situated on a main road so everytime you hopped onto a taxi from the hotel, it would have to take a detour around the back of th hotel to get onto that main road so slightly annoying considering that travel by taxi in dubai is the only way to get around (which is also slightly annoying!!!) The rooms were basic and standard like any other Novotel around the world. But the hotel charges you for everything, including internet use in its business centre. I used the internet in the business centre for no more than 15 minutes and this cost me £7, which is ridiculous. Internet is no longer a luxury and should not be charged, especially in a city that is aiming to be at the forefront of technology. Also, we had settled our bill on departure only for the hotel to charge us additionally for a coke that we supposedly consumed in the mini bar (they went to the trouble of printing an additional invoice to include the coke!). Whether or not we did (I don't even remember) and the cost was beside the point - the hotel should have not bothered with adding it after we had already settled the bill

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a stopover in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Carla045
Reviews.Content: great clean hotel. Can't complain with rate that you pay, ideal for short stopover of 3 nights. If coming to Dubai really recommend you to do Dubai safari and gypsy bedouin camp tough one afternoon/evening, best thing we did during our stay in Dubai. Also if you'd like to eat at the Burj al Arab, book 6 or so weeks before you go.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: Silvereye
Reviews.Content: We got off to a bad start here. Arriving early in the morning (8am) from an overnight flight we had to wait until 11am to access our room, even though an exta night prior to our arrival had been paid for. This problem was eventually sorted out but should not have happened. The rooms are a reasonable size and clean with good bathrooms. We were on the 7th floor with a view of a building site but if you don't like cranes and diggers don't go to Dubai. The public rooms are spacious with comfortable seating and the breakfasts are more than adequate, the usual buffet style. The staff were very efficient and tables were cleared quickly. The hotel has a shuttle to several shopping malls but taxis are cheap. If we go again would probably opt for a hotel at the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable quality stay in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Tequila007
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Novotel Dubai with my wife, trying to have resonably priced, good located nice hotel. It was met and probably even exceeded. Is it best hotel in Dubai - no way, is it reasonable 4* hotel - definitely. The rooms are tiny, standard furnished, typical Novotel. Lobby & check in more in Arabic style, good breakfast, possibility to enjoy draft beer in the evening in Blue Bar. (with some live music), next doors is World Trade Center with some more bars, but mainly the hotel is reasonably far from airport & Deira as well as from newly developing Jumeirah. So, recommended if you're looking for good value for money bed & breakfast kind of stay, and plan to spend the days & nights enjoying Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “It was not bad”
Reviews.Author: ayololu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Novotel between 24th and 31st of August and i must say my check in was very very smooth,it must have been less than 5mins,maybe cos it was in d middle of the night and i had prepaid for the whole week. I went on to my room and it looked cosy enuf ,just that for the price,their beds were toooooo small,the bathroom was nice though the shower gave me small(but neglible) problems atimes,every staff was very pleasant and nice. Problem with this hotel is dat its quite a distance from town so u cant really walk to any mall or anywhere in site once u come back to the hotel in d evening so cabs were a bit expensive to the hotel.the hotel and some malls provided free shuttles to the malls and beach so you have to work with their time and at least get further into town to make ur journey cheaper,they also have a bus in the airport every 30mins from midnight so all you have to do is look out for that The breakfast wasnt very suitable for africans cos it lacked spices and pepper most especially but it was still okay cos of the variety.the pool was FANTASTIC,.1.4M height so anyone and everyone could swim in it,the gym was nice,didint have time to try the massage place. All in all,it was an okay stay,but i might not go there a 2nd time cos i will prefer hotels trekkable to city centre.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AXH
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK, I liked very much the Blue Bar. Room wasn't bad, but nothing to write home about. Good hotel if you are on the budget side.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cjenkinswales
Reviews.Content: We arrived with our small children on 10th August 2008 for a period of 10 days - after a very tiring flight from London Gatwick via Doha, we arrived and had to wait approx 20 minutes for shuttle bus to hotel. When we arrived at hotel - we were welcomed and informed by the reception guy that they only had a smoking room - not very good considering we booked this package holiday 10 weeks earliar, and they had plenty of time to make sure that everything was good before we arrived. I informed him that we have 2 small children and this was not good - especially being so late in night and very tired. Anyway, he informed us we can change rooms in morning. The next morning we made a call to reception and we were moved to a non smoking room. Overall, hotel was fantastic - staff very good and friendly - pool area great and safe for kids as they have a lifeguard there at all times. It was a lovely room and bathroom - only disappointment was very limited place for clothes, especially when you are a family. I did like all the free complimentary magazines and newspapers in reception. You must use the complimentary shuttle bus to the shopping malls, ie Mall of the Emirates, Deira city centre, Maccato.
